title: Re-branding Snowflake text generator into SnowflakeCore
summary: A detailed explanation of why I rebranded my text generator to SnowflakeCore and the importance of clear identity in AI projects.
content:
During the development of my original text generation model, which I named Snowflake, I focused on building a unique architecture from scratch, which I called SnowflakeCore. This architecture is designed to be lightweight, efficient, and customizable for a variety of language modeling tasks.

However, as I began sharing the model on Hugging Face, I realized that the name Snowflake was already in use by an established and verified organization on the platform. This organization has a strong presence with several popular models also named Snowflake, which are fine-tuned variants and widely recognized by the community.

Given their verified status and existing user base, this created a potential for confusion among users and posed challenges for establishing a distinct identity for my project. In addition, it raised concerns about visibility, discoverability, and brand differentiation on the platform.

To resolve these challenges, I decided to rebrand my model under the name SnowflakeCore. This new name preserves the connection to my original architecture while clearly distinguishing it from the existing Snowflake organization.

The rebranding serves several important purposes:

  • Clarity: It prevents any misunderstanding among users about the source and nature of the model.
  • Professionalism: A unique, well-defined brand identity is essential for gaining credibility and trust in the AI community.
  • Ownership: The name SnowflakeCore reflects my personal and technical investment in creating the architecture from the ground up.
  • Future-proofing: As the project grows, having a distinct name reduces risks of conflicts and makes collaboration and dissemination easier.

I remain fully committed to the development and improvement of SnowflakeCore. My goal is to provide an open-source, transparent, and educational tool that can empower developers and researchers to build their own language models effectively.

Thank you for following my journey. I look forward to sharing more updates, tutorials, and insights on SnowflakeCore in the near future.

â€” Daniel

title: Experimenting with TensorFlow for SnowflakeCore
content: I encountered a issue while training SnowflakeCore-G0-R3, that beinf the computation power needed for mapping and training. So I am swithcing from PyTorch to TensorFlow for now so i could use Google's TPUs.

title: Starting the development of SnowflakeCore-G1 and the issues with it
content: Pre-Training G1 it's way too expsnive, using over 300GB of RAM!
